did.unittitle: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia Trustees records

bioghist.p: The Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia was founded in 1812 "for the encouragement and cultivation of the sciences, and the advancement of useful learning." The Board of Trustees of the Academy establishes financial policies for the Academy, selects the President, assists in fundraising and community relations, and serves as a board of review.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the records of the Board of Trustees of the Academy of Natural Science, 1925 to 1990. Materials include minutes of the Board of Trustees, 1925-1989; minutes and correspondence of various Board committees, including Events, Education, Executive, Finance, Audit, Library, and Science, 1970s-1990; a copy of the trustees' handbook; policies and procedures for board meetings and committee work; member lists; materials related to a presidential search and to nominations of board members; committee records (1980s); monthly activity reports submitted by the President to the Board (1978-1980 and 1983-1989); long range planning documents; programs, minutes, and correspondence related to annual meetings 1980-1988; and copies of correspondence from the President's office related to board matters (1937-1955).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
